image.altText: Foam at an Adelaide beach amid an algal bloom.

props.synopsis: Health authorities have told the opening public hearing of a Senate inquiry into South Australia's algal bloom they have escalated their health advice and are now recommending people with asthma carry their medication on the state's beaches when foam is present.

title.children: Algal bloom asthma advice updated, as scientists warn of unknown damage

image.altText: A cafe owner in a kitchen.

props.synopsis: A Port Adelaide cafe owner who says a young staff member was recently knocked over by an aggressive customer has condemned the behaviour, saying he is "sick of seeing it" in the sector.

title.children: Cafe condemns hospitality hostility after young staffer 'hip-and-shouldered'

image.altText: A man wearing a t-shirt and shorts with his face blurred being led into a police paddy wagon by a female officer.

props.synopsis: A Broken Hill man who is facing nearly $1 million in fraud charges under two separate names has his bail conditions tightened, after a court heard police removed him from a flight headed for Adelaide.

title.children: Magistrate tightens bail for accused ATM fraudster after boarding plane

image.altText: A farmer in a navy blue jumper leaning on a post, with cattle feeding on hay in a paddock behind him

props.synopsis: South Australia's Limestone Coast is home to lush terrain in Australia's driest state, but its groundwater supplies are slowly in decline.

title.children: In this food bowl region, the alarm is ringing over water supply

image.altText: Two men smile at the camera in front of a food stall

props.synopsis: Nearly 2,000 people visit the Riverland town of Berri for the region's first Punjabi sport and culture festival, which organisers hope to make a major event.

title.children: Volunteers serve feast for thousands at traditional Indian sports festival

image.altText: A man with beard smiling in a laboratory with measuring instruments on a table

props.synopsis: They're called '"forever chemicals" because of their extreme durability, but Adelaide researchers say they have developed a new method to combat PFAS.

title.children: Researchers develop new material to help combat 'forever chemicals'

image.altText: A white fire truck emblazoned with red and yellow checkered tape and bearing the words Cummins, CFS and Rescue

props.synopsis: A Port Lincoln man has died in a light plane crash in fields at Yeelanna, north of Cummins, on the Eyre Peninsula.

title.children: Pilot dies in light plane crash on SA's Eyre Peninsula

image.altText: Sheep having a feed. Drone photo taken from above.

props.synopsis: The nation's drought supports will come under scrutiny at a major national forum today as southern farmers continue to battle dry times.

title.children: Farmers call for low-interest loans as cash flow dries up in drought

image.altText: a young man in blue and yellow american football gear in a professional photo

props.synopsis: Growing up in South Australia's Riverland, Jake Stoeckel never imagined one day he would be playing college football for the Kent State Golden Flashes in the United States.

title.children: Player 'with natural kick' switches from Aussie Rules to American football

image.altText: A police security office in a navy uniform walks down a road to a large school building

props.synopsis: An 18-year-old was charged in May over alleged threats to use explosives and poisons to target a school and public events in Adelaide.

title.children: Charges dropped against teen accused of threatening staff and students at Adelaide high school

image.altText: A mother smiling and hugging a young boy in Crows top holding a football next to seats at an oval

props.synopsis: AFL barracking is again in the spotlight after the recent booing of a player who was the victim of a slur. Confronted by some of the language they recently heard at a match, footy fans Angela and Archie came up with a "light way to get around a bit of a serious topic".

title.children: Amid booing, sledges and slurs, AFL fans resort to 'swearing spotto'

image.altText: man in bush hat and pink shirt holds up his 4 year old son in stripped shirt

props.synopsis: In outback NSW, fourth-generation farmer Sam Beven is forging the way for the next generation of farming families.

title.children: Young dad takes over sheep station 'bigger than Singapore' to keep legacy

image.altText: Jeffrey Epstein smiles for a photo with Donald Trump

props.synopsis: A lewd note allegedly from Donald Trump wishing late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein happy birthday in 2003 is released by Democrats, after the US president denied it existed.

title.children: Democrats release Trump's alleged birthday note to Epstein

image.altText: Two people wearing possum skins pass a traditional object between each other.

props.synopsis: Victoria's historic treaty is promising to "reckon with the past" and empower the state's First Peoples — and explicitly declares it will not take anything away from the broader community.

title.children: Australia-first treaty with First Peoples to be tabled in Victorian parliament

image.altText: Two men in suits shaking hands

props.synopsis: A landmark $500 million agreement to "transform" the relationship between Australia and Vanuatu still hangs in the balance as Prime Minister Anthony Albanese flies to the Pacific Island nation.

title.children: Albanese flies to Vanuatu for $500m signing ceremony that never happened

image.altText: topless man holds crocodile

props.synopsis: Viral footage of a US social media star handling a deadly saltwater crocodile in Far North Queensland has sparked calls to deport misbehaving influencers.

title.children: Calls for travel ban on risky influencers after croc encounter

image.altText: former thai prime minister thaksin shinawatra gestures with his hands to a crowd of people

props.synopsis: He was previously sentenced to eight years in prison on conflicts of interest and abuse of power charges.

title.children: Former Thai PM Thaksin Shinawatra ordered to serve one year in jail

image.altText: Sam Groth and his wife Brittany, who is smiling, at an election party

props.synopsis: The Herald Sun defamed Victorian Deputy Opposition Leader Sam Groth by implying he sexually assaulted his wife when she was a teenager, according to court documents.

title.children: Herald Sun defamed Sam Groth and invaded wife's privacy, MP claims

image.altText: An Australian soccer player slides on his knees in celebration after scoring a goal.

props.synopsis: Mohamed Toure takes full advantage of his start with a slick finish to put the Socceroos ahead in the first half against New Zealand in Auckland. Follow live.

title.children: VAR denies Toure a hat-trick as Socceroos young guns dominate NZ

image.altText: A composite image of a man and three children.

props.synopsis: How the search for New Zealand fugitive and father of three Tom Phillips concluded after nearly three years.

title.children: Inside the final moments of a fugitive who evaded police for 1,358 days in the bush

image.altText: Storm clouds drop heavy rain in the distance on a western Queensland property

props.synopsis: The Bureau of Meteorology is making a major change to how they assess El Niño and La Niña, the world's most dominant drivers of weather variability.

title.children: Climate change forces BOM to overhaul El Niño and La Niña analysis

image.altText: The logo of the ANZ Banking Group is displayed in the window of a newly opened branch in central Sydney

props.synopsis: ANZ announces a restructure that will see thousands of roles go and fewer contracts with consultants and third parties.

title.children: 'This is the right thing to do': ANZ to cut 3,500 jobs in next year

image.altText: Man and woman embrace in selfie photo

props.synopsis: Mercury Psillakis had earned a black belt in Taekwondo and travelled the world surfing, his family reveals in a statement.

title.children: Shark attack victim's death an 'unavoidable accident', family says

image.altText: A group of people in a crowd hold smart phones and signs and appear to be mid-chant.

props.synopsis: After protests in Indonesia turned deadly, Indonesian diaspora communities across the world have held peaceful demonstrations to make the same demands as friends and family back home.

title.children: 'We are all angry': Indonesian protests spread across the world

image.altText: A apir of mailboxes. One red, one yellow.

props.synopsis: Australia Post is resuming all US shipping within weeks, after the national delivery service found a way to meet new US tariff rules.

title.children: Australia Post to resume US shipping after meeting tariff rules

image.altText: A greyscale image showing a dark silhouette of a boat in water, illuminated by a spotlight and a downward, flame in the sky

props.synopsis: The Global Sumud Flotilla for Gaza says one of its main boats has been struck by a drone in Tunisian waters but all six passengers and crew are safe.

title.children: Flotilla for Gaza says boat struck by drone in Tunisian waters

image.altText: The minister speaking in a suit at parliament house.

props.synopsis: Australia's education minister believes a new super commission will address rising school dropout rates, but he still needs to convince the states to support a greater federal role, writes Conor Duffy.

title.children: 'We need more students to finish school': Education minister proposes public school shake-up

image.altText: Composite images of Australian track and field athletes Torrie Lewis, Gout Gout and Delta Amidzovski in action

props.synopsis: Armed with the largest team ever assembled for a major athletics meet, Australia enters the World Athletics Championships with a sense of excitement.

title.children: 'Little things' driving Australia's golden generation of athletics stars

image.altText: Tayla with her fingers up.

props.synopsis: The New South Wales government put Tayla in the residential care system, where the girl with high needs and multiple diagnoses was pulled into a cycle of sexual abuse.

title.children: 'Hate her for this': Ex-state ward says another child exposed her to abuse

image.altText: E Jean Carroll, wearing a navy blazer, white shirt and sunglasses, walks through supporters holding up anti-Donald Trump signs.

props.synopsis: The US president fails in his bid to appeal a jury decision to award writer E Jean Carroll $US83 million ($126m) for sexual assault and defamation.

title.children: Trump loses appeal against E Jean Carroll for sexual assault and defamation

image.altText: Jacinta Nampijinpa Price in the senate

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese says Liberal senator Jacinta Nampijinpa Price should apologise to Indian Australians for her remarks, as a test for Opposition Sussan Ley emerges.

title.children: PM says Nampijinpa Price should apologise for Indian remarks

image.altText: A woman sits with her head down

props.synopsis: The children's remains were found when the unclaimed suitcases were sold at auction by the facility.

title.children: Mother of two children found dead in suitcases faces court pleads not guilty

image.altText: Hannah Thomas with glasses outside court.

props.synopsis: Hannah Thomas's lawyer, Peter O'Brien, told the magistrate he will pursue costs in relation to the criminal proceedings that have been withdrawn.

title.children: Charges dropped against ex-Greens candidate injured in protest arrest

image.altText: Broughton Street, Singleton

props.synopsis: A 17-year-old girl dies after being attacked by a dog while visiting a friend's home in the Hunter Valley last week.

title.children: Teenage girl dies in hospital after NSW dog attack

image.altText: The five Spice Girls doing peace signs next to a young Prince Charles, looking embarrassed with a lipstick mark on his cheek

props.synopsis: When Mel C first auditioned for a new girl group in 1994, she had no idea what kind of journey she was about to embark on. She talks to Zan Rowe about the moments that made the Spice Girls.

title.children: How the Spice Girls fired their management and took over the world
